page.title: 08CHURCHES
page.content: Although very few people live in the surrounding area, there are many small churches around. In this particular area there are two, at Burwell and Ruckland. The church that we went to was called St. Olav's. It is about 100 years old but was rebuilt on the site of a very early church. There is still part of a Celtic cross to be seen set into one of the walls. It is a tiny church and is now one of a group of parishes which have a rotation of services. Although the regular services are badly attended, there is a lot of local support and interest. An annual flower festival is always well supported. The larger and older church in Burwell has been made redundant.
